ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Alport's syndrome
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient has a history of Alport's syndrome, kidney transplant, and dialysis, along with a family history (mother) and progressive sensorineural hearing loss characteristic of the condition.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, configuration, and symmetry of hearing loss given the reported rapid decline.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and screen for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry reveals a bilateral, symmetrical, mild sloping to moderately-severe sensorineural hearing loss. Speech reception thresholds agree with pure-tone averages, and word recognition is good at suprathreshold levels. Immittance testing shows normal middle ear function with acoustic reflexes consistent with cochlear pathology (present at lower frequencies, absent/elevated at higher frequencies).

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral mild SNHL at 250 Hz, sloping to moderate/moderately-severe at 500-6000 Hz, rising to moderate at 8000 Hz. Right PTA 48 dB HL, Left PTA 53 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 48 dB HL, Left 53 dB HL. WRS Right 84% at 85 dB HL, Left 90% at 85 dB HL.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right: Ipsi present 500-1000 Hz, absent 2000-4000 Hz; Contra absent. Left: Ipsi present 500-4000 Hz; Contra present 500-1000 Hz, absent 2000-4000 Hz. Decay negative where measurable.

proposed_items: Evaluation for Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT) options
counseling_actions: Explain the relationship between Alport's syndrome and hearing loss
Discuss the progressive nature of the hearing loss
Advise on the importance of annual monitoring

escalation.rationale_short: For medical clearance for amplification and evaluation of the reported rapid decline in hearing.
